body:
@aoen Seems that we are pretty close! Would you mind squashing the commits? I'm starting to read change on change and that is getting kind of confusing.

Secondly, I see the code now is elaborately commented - can the relevant bits also be added to the user documentation? Lastly, there are some TODO items can these be added to the TODO (although that place seems a bit dated).

@aoen 

> @bolkedebruin I think I have addressed the comments and am ready to do a final round of manual testing (e.g. with the sudoers file) before merging, let me know if I missed anything (I'm blocking this PR on your LGTM).

I'm +1 from visual code inspection, I would like to do a final review of reading it when it is squashed. User documentation / TODO should be in as well before merge.

My plan would be to merge it to master test it locally let it rest for a bit and then merge it to v1-8-test. Are you guys running vanilla 1.8 yet? In other words if you have this running in your environment is it part of the Apache 1.8 or a fork?

Should we start thinking about putting those in `/var/logs` by the way?

LGTM otherwise

@bolkedebruin 
Squashed the commits

I previously added documentation for the sudoers file and such, but would be happy to add more. Can you tell me the specific areas you feel could use some detail?

I think TODO should be deprecated and we should use Jira/Confluence going forward. I will file a JIRA for these TODOs once this change is merged:
```
+        # TODO(aoen): Make log dirs and logs globally readable for now since the SubDag
+        # operator is not compatible with impersonation (e.g. if a Celery executor is used
+        # for a SubDag operator and the SubDag operator has a different owner than the
+        # parent DAG)

+        # TODO(plypaul) Monitoring the the control file in the cgroup fs is better than
+        # checking the return code here. The PR to use this is here:
+        # https://github.com/plypaul/airflow/blob/e144e4d41996300ffa93947f136eab7785b114ed/airflow/contrib/task_runner/cgroup_task_runner.py
+        # but there were some issues installing the python butter package and
+        # libseccomp-dev on some hosts for some reason.
+        # I wasn't able to track down the root cause of the package install failures, but
+        # we might want to revisit that approach at some other point.
```

We are still running off of the old release (1.7.1), I will run this change through staging before the final merge however. If there are issues after that in 1.8beta, I will be responsible for fixing them.
Really excited for this! Was wondering if you have an approximate release date for this upcoming version (1.8)?

Apart from some small nits, I am +1 (merging to master first, do integration tests, make part of 1.8 if successful).

Awesome!

P.S. Did we break a record with the amount of comments? 😂

See Airflow 1.8.0 BETA 1 Thread:

RELEASE PLANNING

Beta 2: 20 Jan
Beta 3: 25 Jan
RC1:  2 Feb


RC1 should be equal to release if all goes as planned (but no guarantees), besides it needs to go through the voting process of the IPMC and they might require some adjustments.

Bolke

> On 18 Jan 2017, at 20:40, Ivan Gozali <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> Really excited for this! Was wondering if you have an approximate release date for this upcoming version (1.8)?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/2000#issuecomment-273578828>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AEFZWIFqjoQv3VPnbsoNq6bJEN7zurOFks5rTmqjgaJpZM4LmEVb>.
>

> I think TODO should be deprecated and we should use Jira/Confluence going forward. I will file a JIRA for these TODOs once this change is merged:

I'm fine with inline todo's as well. Jira can be a bit unclear and I foresee we might move away from it again.
@artwr I think we need to rework logging entirely. It is a confusing mess imho :). But /var/log seems a great start.
Addressed comments.
LGTM, merging to master.
Wait, let me do a quick round of staging first on the Airbnb staging env. I can merge myself in a little bit.
Sure (pfeeeew that was pretty close :) )

@artwr, So I re-PR'd https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/989 along with detection of variable and resource file changes. As for the code-quality, I think I can put the extra code in their own file and get rid of the sub functions. I can also add unit tests. Not sure what the travis-ci failures are. Not much experience with travis ci so I don't know how to interpret the logs. Would you please advice when you get a chance. Thank you.
I hit some issues but they look unrelated. Will further test and debug in the beta. Going to merge this.
dont know what username to use to run the unit test ( has to be provided as ssh_default connection ), so I am adding back to use default system user as username so unit tests does not fail.
@aminghadersohi Travis seems to have passed, it's landscape.io which seems unhappy. You seem to have merge conflicts though, so you would need to rebase.
@artwr, thanks! will take care of the code quality stuff!
Please make sure to add unit tests to this that tests all flows.

@bolkedebruin If you cut a new beta with this change (or provide me with the process to a cut a new beta myself) I can get started on staging the changes.
@aoen new beta will be out tomorrow per planning to allow the first beta to settle a bit and allow people to report issues. ETA in 12 hours.

Makes sense, thanks!

@aminghadersohi There is a small gotcha. Now that airflow is a project under the Apache Incubator umbrella, all files need to have the following license at the top, or a compatible license : 
```
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
# http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.
#
```
Rat is a script that checks license compatibility, and that we have integrated to our travis checks. It sometimes complains when more files are added as the number of files without a license must decrease.
While I do not think we can relicense some of those files, I think we can exclude some. 
I think you should add the following to https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/blob/master/.rat-excludes : 
`airflow/www/static/coverage/*`
